metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13376 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: phpBB version 3.2.7 allows the stealing of an Administration Control Panel session id by leveraging CSRF in the Remote Avatar feature. The CSRF Token Hijacking leads to stored XSS It was discovered that phpBB has a XSS vulnerability. An attacker could possibly use this do cause a Denial of Service or execute arbitrary code.

criterions.comment: phpbb3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
